about.title: Who's behind DRK LAB?
about.description: DRK LAB is the personal project of Fran, an audiovisual technician and cinematographer. Working daily with cameras, lenses and lights in a rental, I've seen first-hand what breaks, what gets lost and what’s missing in the cases. DRK LAB parts come from there: small, focused solutions for very specific problems.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: If you're a rental, production company or freelance technician and have an idea or on-set problem, drop me a line and we'll see how to solve it.
contact.tagline: Built in Catalonia for shoots everywhere.

why.title: What kind of projects is DRK LAB a good fit for?
why.description: If you have a very specific problem on set, it can probably be turned into a part or system that makes your life easier.
bullets: Rental houses that need robust accessories for their camera, lighting and monitor inventory.
Production companies looking to solve a recurring problem on shoots or tours.
Freelance technicians who want reliable parts for their kit (camera, sound, gaffer…).
Teams aiming to improve the organisation of media, batteries and small accessories.
Spare parts and components that are no longer manufactured but are still needed.

process.kicker: HOW DO WE WORK ON YOUR PROJECT?
process.title: Fast, without losing the technical edge
process.description: Always tested in real-world conditions, not just in 3D.

steps.title: Initial brief
steps.text: You send me an email explaining the issue, the equipment you use and, if possible, a photo or video of the problem on set.

steps.title: Design & validation
steps.text: I propose a part or system, we iterate as needed and validate that it fits and withstands real working conditions.

steps.title: Production & delivery
steps.text: Once validated, the parts are manufactured in technical materials and we agree on quantities, lead times and shipping.

productDetail.ctaDescription: DRK LAB mostly works on demand for rentals, production companies and technicians. Tell me what you need and we'll see if this model fits or needs adapting.

aboutPage.heroSubtitle: DRK LAB was born from a dangerous mix: a rental technician surrounded by cameras all day, an obsession with well-designed solutions and a 3D printer that almost never stops. I design parts made for real-world use: robust, functional and with zero tolerance for cheap plastic that breaks on the first shoot.
aboutPage.whoBody: My name is Fran. I’m an audiovisual technician, Director of Photography and a bit of a maker addict. I work every day at a professional rental house, which gives me something very valuable: I see up close what breaks, what’s missing and what could be much better designed. DRK LAB is my personal lab, where I turn those needs into real parts: card cases, protectors, mounts, grips and custom pieces that don’t exist in any catalogue but make life easier on set.
aboutPage.howItem1Body: Everything starts with something annoying: a cap that keeps falling off, an adapter that doesn’t exist or an official accessory that’s too expensive for what it does. From there we define what needs to be solved and in which real-world context it will be used.
aboutPage.howItem2Body: I work in Fusion 360 with parametric models. That allows me to tweak dimensions, tolerances and variants for different cameras, rigs or workflows without redesigning everything from scratch every time.
aboutPage.howItem3Body: Parts are tested in rental environments and on real sets. If something doesn’t survive the pace of a shooting day, it gets redesigned. The goal is not only to look good in photos, but to work in the hands of a stressed technician.
aboutPage.howItem4Body: I print mainly on Bambu Lab printers and switch to technical materials when needed: matte PLA for general product, reinforced materials for parts that need to withstand impacts, heat or continuous load.
aboutPage.forWhoBody: DRK LAB is built for people who actually live in the audiovisual world and need more than generic accessories from a catalogue.
aboutPage.forWhoItem1: Rental houses looking for tailored solutions for their camera and monitor fleet.
aboutPage.forWhoItem2: Production companies and operators who need robust accessories for specific workflows.
aboutPage.forWhoItem3: Technicians who are tired of fixing everything with zip ties, gaffer tape and parts that almost fit.
aboutPage.philosophyTitle: What DRK LAB is not (and what it is)
aboutPage.philosophyBody: DRK LAB is not a huge factory or an endless marketplace. I’m not trying to compete with cheap plastic, but with solutions that actually get used every day. I don’t make parts that are only "pretty" for Instagram: they have to work on set. I’m not chasing absolute perfection, but I do care about precision so everything fits right the first time. And above all, I don’t sell hype: if something isn’t a good idea for your use case, I’ll tell you.
aboutPage.ctaTitle: Got a specific problem on set?
aboutPage.ctaBody: Tell me what you’re missing: a case, a mount, an adapter or something that doesn’t exist yet. Let’s see if DRK LAB is the right fit or if there’s a simpler way to solve it.

projectTypes: Rentals that need robust accessories for their cameras, lights and monitors.

contactPage.workflowTitle: How will we work on your project?
contactPage.workflowIntro: The idea is to move fast but stay technical. Always with real-world testing, not just pretty 3D renders.

workflowSteps.title: Initial brief
workflowSteps.body: You send an email explaining the issue, which gear you’re using and, if possible, some photos or a short video from the set.

workflowSteps.title: Design and validation
workflowSteps.body: I propose a part or system, we iterate as needed and validate that it fits and survives day-to-day use.

workflowSteps.title: Production and delivery
workflowSteps.body: Once validated, the final parts are produced in technical materials and we agree on quantities, lead times and shipping.

contactPage.panelBody: You don’t need to have the solution figured out. Share the context and we’ll see if it makes sense to turn it into a DRK LAB part or if there’s a simpler path.
contactPage.emailHelper: You can write in English, Spanish or Catalan.
contactPage.responseTimeNote: I try to answer all emails within 24–48 business hours, depending on current shoots and production load.
contactPage.footerBody: If you already know which cameras, lenses, monitors or lights you’re using, include that in the email. The more specific the context, the easier it is to propose a useful solution on the first try.

servicesPage.heroTitle: Services built for real-world production work
servicesPage.heroSubtitle: DRK LAB is not just a catalogue of parts. It’s a small lab to spot problems on set, prototype quickly and deliver solutions that are ready to work from day one.
servicesPage.linesTitle: What can I help you with?
servicesPage.linesIntro: I mostly work with rental houses, production companies and technicians who need very specific parts, usually for yesterday. These are the main pillars of DRK LAB:

lines.title: 3D design for set work
lines.body: Design of parts made for real use: caps, protectors, adapters, mounts, rigs and small problem-solving tools. Everything starts from a real-world need, not from a theoretical catalogue.

lines.title: Fast prototyping for rentals and crews
lines.body: From idea or problem to a functional part in very little time. We can iterate quickly until we find the perfect fit: not too tight, not too loose.

lines.title: Production using technical materials
lines.body: Printing with materials that match each use case: matte PLA for general product, reinforced materials for parts that must handle impacts, heat or continuous load.

lines.title: Functional merch for the audiovisual world
lines.body: Tool-keychains, small accessories and useful parts with your logo built-in. Merch designed to live on set, not to stay forgotten in a drawer.

servicesPage.casesTitle: Typical projects I get asked for
servicesPage.casesIntro: If any of these situations sound familiar, there’s a good chance DRK LAB can help:
cases: You have a fleet of cameras or monitors and you’re missing a very specific part to protect or mount them.
You need to replace parts that are no longer manufactured, but the kit still has plenty of life ahead.
You want media cases tailored exactly to your camera kit or to a specific production.
You’re looking for useful merch for a rental house, production company or film school: small tools that actually get used.
You’ve hacked together a fix with zip ties or tape and now you’d like a proper part instead.
servicesPage.rentalsBody: Coming from the rental world myself, I know the pace of shooting days and the reality of gear constantly going in and out. DRK LAB can help standardise solutions, reduce last-minute hacks in the warehouse and extend the life of gear that still works, even if the manufacturer has moved on.
servicesPage.ctaBody: Tell me what’s going on: which camera, monitor or light it is, what part is missing and how the kit is used. From there we’ll see whether you need a new part, a variation of an existing one or if there’s a simpler route.

customPage.heroTitle: 3D engineering for very specific on-set problems.
customPage.heroSubtitle: When the standard catalogue doesn’t solve it, DRK LAB steps in. Parts designed from real rental and set experience, with tight tolerances and technical materials.
customPage.processIntro: You don’t need a technical drawing. Just tell me what’s happening on set and which camera, monitor or light you’re using.

processSteps.title: 1 · Quick brief and context
processSteps.body: You explain the problem: what gear you use, what breaks, gets lost or is simply annoying. Photos or a short video from the set help a lot.

processSteps.title: 2 · 3D design and prototype
processSteps.body: I create the model in Fusion 360, thinking about real tolerances and how it will be mounted on set. We can run one or two test iterations until it fits properly.

processSteps.title: 3 · Production in technical materials
processSteps.body: Once the prototype is validated, the final parts are produced in materials such as PAHT CF, PA12 or TPU, depending on whether they need to handle impacts, temperature or flex.

customPage.examplesTitle: What kind of parts do I usually make?
customPage.examplesIntro: Most projects come from rentals, camera operators and technicians who need something very specific that doesn’t exist in any catalogue.
examples: Adapters and brackets for cameras, monitors and wireless receivers.
Protection for LED heads, sun hoods and light modifiers.
Media cases and organisers for cards, batteries and small accessories.
Replacement parts that are no longer manufactured, or weak parts redesigned to last longer.
Handles, rails and rigging parts built to survive daily use.
customPage.materialsTitle: Materials chosen to work hard, not just to look good.
customPage.materialsBody: I mainly work with Bambu Lab printers and technical materials: PAHT CF and PA12 for rigid structures, TPU for flexible areas and high-quality PLA when we don’t need to push things so far. Always prioritising durability, tolerances and easy maintenance for rentals.
customPage.ctaTitle: Got a very specific problem on set?
customPage.ctaBody: If you have a camera, support, adapter or idea that doesn’t exist yet, we can see if it makes sense to turn it into a DRK LAB part.

drk-cap-led.name: DRK-CAP LED · Bowens Protection Cap
drk-cap-led.longDescription: Protective cap for LED heads with Bowens mount, 3D printed in translucent PETG with a semi-transparent finish. Designed to protect the COB and front optics during transport, storage, and the daily workload of a rental environment.
features: Semi-transparent translucent PETG: visually clean protection.
Protects the COB and front optics during transport in flightcases and on-set operation
Compatibility tested with Bowens-mount heads from leading brands (see specifications)
Option for tinted translucency and custom logo in multiple colors
Designed from real rental use: practical, robust and fast-fitting

technicalSpecs.label: Customization
technicalSpecs.value: Tinted translucency + custom logo in multiple colors (on request)

technicalSpecs.label: Tested compatibility
technicalSpecs.value: Aputure 600C/D, 1200D/X/C · Nanlite Forza 300/500/720 B/C · Amaran 300/150C · Nanlux Evoke 600C · SmallRig 120/220B

technicalSpecs.label: Material notes
technicalSpecs.value: PETG offers good impact resistance and dimensional stability, with higher heat tolerance than PLA. Its translucent finish makes it easy to quickly identify the head while providing a premium look.

technicalSpecs.label: High-temp alternatives
technicalSpecs.value: Can be manufactured in higher temperature-resistant materials if required (typically losing translucency), depending on the use case and LED head.

drk-cap-led.notes: Likely compatible with other Bowens-mount heads from the same brands, but only the listed models have been tested and validated.
